newsitem.title: LEBANON: Ceasefire group says Israel, guerrillas set bombs.
newsitem.headline: Ceasefire group says Israel, guerrillas set bombs.

text.p: A five-nation group monitoring a ceasefire understanding in Lebanon said on Thursday Israel or its allies placed a bomb that killed two civilians and wounded two in a Shi'ite Moslem town in south Lebanon on Tuesday.
It also said Lebanese guerrillas placed a bomb near a south Lebanon village a day earlier which injured four Lebanese civilians and two fighters of the pro-Israeli South Lebanese Army (SLA) militia.

Under the U.S.-brokered ceasefire understanding of April 26, 1996, which ended a 17-day Israeli blitz on Lebanon, both sides are barred from carrying out attacks on or from inhabited areas of Lebanon or Israel.
The group, which comprises the United States, France, Israel, Syria and Lebanon, said both actions breached the ceasefire understanding.

"The Monitoring Group accepted as factual that Israeli forces or those cooperating with them placed four explosive devices at the site of an unfinished building near inhabited houses in Nabatiyeh," the monitoring group said in a statement after examining complaints by both sides.
"The explosion of three of these devices killed two civilians and injured two others. The remaining device, which was examined by the Group, had Hebrew markings," it said.

"With regard to the Israeli complaint, the Monitoring Group accepted as factual that a Lebanese armed group placed an explosive device at a cinder block workshop near inhabited houses in the environs of el-Klea. The target was military. The explosion injured civilians as well as soldiers cooperating with Israeli forces," the statement said.
"The Monitoring Group determined that placement of such explosive devices in a civilian populated area violates the April 26, 1996, understanding," it added.
The April agreement reserves the right of guerrillas to fight Israeli troops holding a 15 km (nine-mile) -wide occupation zone.
The pro-Iranian Hizbollah (Party of God) leads an Islamic resistance committed to ousting Israeli troops and the SLA from south Lebanon.
